content: So we had a design meeting scheduled for today to talk about streams. However, in light of the mozilla layoffs, I would like to postpone, in particular since I have a meeting I have to attend that overlaps with our lang-team slot.
(But also because several would-be participants were affected either directly or indirectly and I'd like to give some time)
@T-lang :point_up:
I'm going to take the chance to move it to next week
Hey @T-lang I'm actually going to bump this another week -- I was just talking to @Nell Shamrell-Harrington and she would like to attend, but she is busy with RustConf duties tomorrow
Hey @T-lang and @WG-async-foundations, the meeting on Stream RFC takes place in ~40 minutes, at 2020-08-26T13:00:00-04:00
Here is a hackmd with some initial notes
that @Nell Shamrell-Harrington and I prepared
if someone could PM me the info for the zoom meeting I would appreciate it.

Question on method ambiguity: when using the Trait::method(target) syntax, doesn't that provide a resolution to specify which method you want to use? https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=4c53d032b04d909c0c36d0875cc8c270

basically the idea of propane is to implement the least expressive viable point in the design space for generators and then see how frustrating the limitations are to consider expanding the expressiveness
